My name is Natalia Iannucci, and I am an incoming first year Biostatistics PhD Candidate in Fall 2022 at Johns Hopkins University School of Public Health. I graduated from [Smith College](https://www.smith.edu/academics/statistics) in May 2022 with a B.A. in Mathematics, and in Statistical & Data Sciences with Highest Honors on my departmental honors thesis. I am interested in continuing my research on genetic mutations, statistical genetics, and techniques to work with large-scale genomic data.

I am highly profficient in coding and conducting complex statistical analyses in R, and have some experience in Python. Relevant undergraduate courses I have taken include: Introduction to Data Science, Introduction to Computer Science through Programming, Calculus II, Calculus III, Advance Calculus, Discrete Mathematics, Linear Algebra, Multiple Regression, Probability, Mathematical Statistics, Bayesian Analysis, Advanced Programming for Data Science, Real Analysis, Statistical & Data Sciences Capstone, Communicating with Data, Modeling for Machine Learning, Graph Theory, Advanced General Chemistry with Lab, Cells Physiology & Development with Lab.

You can find me on GitHub @niannucci, where I have repositories containing some of my work, including assignments and projects from my undergraduate courses. I can also be found on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/iannuccinatalia/).
